definition: abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

pinyin: Fei1 zhou1 ren2 guo2 min2 da4 hui4

sentences.english: and you have a lot of Africans in London.
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦，你能见到很多非洲人。

sentences.english: Sometimes, there are over 1000 Africans attending mass.
sentences.chinese: 有时侯，会有超过1000名非洲人参加弥撒。

sentences.english: Increasingly, however, it is the Chinese who play Africans off against each other.
sentences.chinese: 然而，是中国人越来越多地操纵非洲人之间相互作对。

sentences.english: Africans could have built upon this system.
sentences.chinese: 非洲人本可以建立了这样的机制。

sentences.english: Helping Africa is a good thing but, then, so is selling dog food.
sentences.chinese: 帮助非洲人是一件好事，但卖狗粮也是。

sentences.english: Could the Olmec heads depict African visitors from across the Atlantic?
sentences.chinese: 欧梅克头像是描述成功走过大西洋而来的非洲人吗？

sentences.english: Fresh ginger is used in Asian and oriental cookery.
sentences.chinese: 非洲人和东方人用新鲜的生姜来烹饪。

sentences.english: Termites are a gourmet treat in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 白蚁是非洲人的美味佳肴。

sentences.english: There's no doubt Africans have borne the brunt of the AIDS epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，非洲人受到艾兹病流行的影响最大。

sentences.english: And here in London, you have a lot of Africans.
Eight hundred million Africans would get a tremendous boost to their self-esteem and cultural pride.
sentences.chinese: 8亿非洲人将大大增强他们的自尊和文化自豪感。

sentences.english: She says the Africans currently residing in the camp are desperate to get away.
sentences.chinese: 现在住在收容营里的非洲人迫切希望离开。

sentences.english: Posted on a street-side photography stall are several souvenir photographs of Africans.
sentences.chinese: 一个街头照相摊上上贴着几张非洲人的留念照。

sentences.english: The first Africans were brought to American in 1619.
sentences.chinese: 第一批的非洲人于一六一九年被带到美洲。

sentences.english: The blues grew out of African spirituals and work songs.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯乐成长自非洲人的精神和劳动号子中。

definition: Africa/abbr. for 阿非利加洲[A1 fei1 li4 jia1 Zhou1]
